thread.title: Oscars 2017 best dressed: Karlie Kloss, Emma Stone, Ruth Negga and more bring glamour to the Academy Awards carpet
thread.title_full: Oscars 2017 best dressed: Karlie Kloss, Emma Stone, Ruth Negga and more bring glamour to the Academy Awards carpet

author: Zoe Shenton
title: Oscars 2017 best dressed: Karlie Kloss, Emma Stone, Ruth Negga and more bring glamour to the Academy Awards carpet
text:
Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
The 89th annual Academy Awards red carpet was awash with beautiful ball gowns, fresh whites and stunning silvers and golds. 
The stars pulled out all the stops for the biggest night in the showbiz calendar, dazzling in custom-made emsembles as they walked the carpet at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood. 
Leading the best dressed list was model Karlie Kloss, 24, who looked radiant in a white asymmetrical Stella McCartney gown. 
The glamorous look, which featured a built-in cape, was perfectly complimented by Karlie's loose blonde waves and gorgeous chunky diamond choker. Karlie Kloss was ozzing glamour in Stella McCartney (Photo: AFP/Getty) Ruth Negga looked red hot in custom-made Valentino (Photo: REUTERS) 
Chrissy Teigen also opted to wear white and looked a picture of perfection in her angelic thigh split white gown by Zuhair Murad. 
Ruth Negga, who is nominated for her role in Loving, in which she plays the real-life Mildred Loving, who was jailed for entering a mixed-race marriage with husband Richard in 1950s Virginia, opted for a bold red lace custom-made Valentino gown. Taraji P. Henson (Photo: WireImage) Isabelle Huppert stunned in this look (Photo: AFP) 
The high collar look, which featured a hint of lace and a little transparency, was definitely a head turner. 
Like Karlie and many others, the 35-year-old actress honoured the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) with a small blue ribbon pinned to her dress. Read More Chrissy also opted for white (Photo: Rex Features) Halle Berry wowed in this ensemble (Photo: Getty Images North America) 
Emma Stone, who is up for Best Actress, stuck to one of the trends of the night and glittered in a gold fringe Givenchy dress. 
Taraji P. Henson was also oozing old school Hollywood glamour in an off the shoulder black velvet Alberta Ferretti gown, which featured a sexy thigh split. 
The actress teamed the dress with simple black heels and a statement necklace. 
Kirstent Dunst also went down the super glam route in a show-stopping black Dior gown. 
While style savvy Janelle Monae turned heads in an Elie Saab Haute couture gown that featured layers of metallic beads, tulle and sequins. Read More Janelle Monae (Photo: Rex Features) Kirsten Dunst (Photo: Getty Images North America) Jessica Biel and Justin Timberlake made a pretty duo (Photo: WireImage) Read More Natalie Portman reveals she won't be attending the Oscars due to pregnancy 
"Her dress tonight is definitely an Oscars dress and there would be nowhere else in the world she could wear this dress. There would be nowhere else in the world she could wear this dress," her stylist said of the look. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
